comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: According to the Wikipedia article on Owen Johnson, [ en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Owen_Johnson ] "His first wife died in 1910. His second wife was Esther Ellen Cobb, whom he divorced in 1917. His third wife was Cecile Denise de la Garde, who died in 1918. His fourth wife was Catherine Sayre Burton, who died in 1921. His fifth wife was Gertrude Bovee Le Boutillier. He was the father of five children." So this is probably Esther Ellen Cobb, given the time frame of the Bain collection.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: According to listsearches.rootsweb.ancestry.com/th/read/ORLAKE/2008-03... which reproduces THE NEW ERA, ALTURAS, MODOC COUNTY, CAL of WEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 7, 1912, "Miss Esther Cobb, a Lakeview [Oregon] girl who is well-known here and who has made a world-wide reputation for herself as an opera singer, was married on January 31st, 1912, in New York, to Owen Johnson, editor of The Century Magazine. So the photo could be from early 1912.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: She went by Madame Cobina professionally, and later as Cobina Wright (and then Cobina Wright, Sr, to distinguish herself from her daughter), according to the following news articles. DIVORCES OWEN JOHNSON.; Nevada Decree for Mme. Cobina on Ground of Desertion. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9A03EFD9123AE433A... "Full Dress" from TIME magazine of Monday, Feb. 11, 1935 has more about her second marriage, to William May Wright, of the New York Stock Exchange. She had an interesting life!! www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,748394,00.html?... Bio from IMDB at www.imdb.com/name/nm0942174/bio digitalgallery.nypl.org/nypldigital/id?TH-63318 is a picture of Cobina Wright, Sr. I can believe it's the same person.

comment.author: 40472720@N00
comment._content: Wow, Mr. Johnson had some trouble with the wives, eh?

comment._content: traded them in when the ashtrays were full as it were
